Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.santorini.model.gameoperations

Class GameOperation<T extends GameOperationState,​S extends ApplicableRules<T,​?>>

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.santorini.model.gameoperations.GameOperation<T,​S>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of the supported GameOperationState to use for the rules application
S - The type of the needed rules for the execution of the operation
All Implemented Interfaces:
ExpandableGameOperation
Direct Known Subclasses:
Build, Move
public abstract class GameOperation<T extends GameOperationState,​S extends ApplicableRules<T,​?>>
extends java.lang.Object
implements ExpandableGameOperation
Brief Represents a Game Operation. A Game Operation is a executable process that take use of rules and of a delegate to compute the allowed choices a user can take and actually request a choice from them during the game play. It also makes use of a state to store changes step by step during the whole process. After execution it provides a GameOperationResult to update the situation of the execution pipeline between some consecutive game operations. It also handles the parts of worker/position selection, and win/loss checks processes
See Also:
Rules, GameOperationState, GameOperationResult
